name: Go Go Ackman
description:
Ackman is not what one would call a good person. His job is to murder and steal souls for the Demon Lord. The angel Tenshi has taken it upon himself to put an end to Ackman's nefarious ways, and sends an army of angels and hired assassins to take out Ackman for good. It's just as well, because Ackman was getting bored without anyone to kill.

Go Go Ackman is a scrolling platformer starring the titular Ackman. Ackman can punch and charge up a ranged wave of energy, and he can also jump on some enemies to stun them before running into them and turning them into a sliding projectile. Ackman can hold up to three bombs that can clear the screen of enemies, and can also hold a weapon, either a sword, boomerang, or pistol, but it will be lost if Ackman is hit. Levels are linear, but do allow some exploration to find weapons and items hidden off the beaten road.

shot.caption: Title screen.
Tenshi summons his minions in the opening cutscene.
Starting Stage 1.
Ackman is no friend of the angels.
All sorts of unique enemies show up in each stage.
Finding bonuses off the beaten trail.
Yeeeeeeah I think I see why this game was never released outside of Japan.
Angels upgrade to arrow-delivered ICBMs.
The first of Tenshi's hired assassins. This mid-boss does not appear on easy mode.
They see me rollin'
Someone really ought to fix these potholes.
He huffs and he puffs and he charges Ackman down.
A dramatic retelling of your (un)heroic deeds.
Well, she's not a Bombchu Girl, but she's close.
This time Tenshi sics a trained martial artist on Ackman.
Look down, look up, I'm on a boat, being attacked by birds.
Ackman doesn't care much for swimming.
The last of Stage 2's bosses.
I've been in the sun too long.
This stage's first boss challenges Ackman to a dance battle.
Angels, tired of being beat up, have started wearing armor.
It's like they get these tomb traps out of an IKEA catalog.
Oh yeah, it's jet-pack time!
These student witches will toss
I hate cephalopods.
You look familiar.
Game Over
